source_sentence: 「爾時迦毘羅城，有諸釋種五百大臣，皆悉是於菩薩眷屬，還復造立五百精舍，擬菩薩坐。
translation: "At the time, there were five hundred ministers of the Śākyas in Kapilavastu, all of whom were members of the bodhisattva's retinue, and they also built five hundred other refectories, each intended for the bodhisattva to sit in.

source_sentence: 當於菩薩初入城時，各各立在自家門前，以歡喜心，合掌恭敬而作是言：『願天中天，入我精舍；願大船師，入我精舍；願身金色清淨眾生，入我精舍；願施一切歡喜心者，入我精舍；願名遠聞、無毀缺者，入我精舍；願德最尊、無等等者，入我精舍。』
translation: When the bodhisattvas first entered the city, they each stood in front of their own house, put their palms together in rejoicing, paid respect, and said, 'May the god of gods enter my monastery; may the great shipmaster enter my monastery; may sentient beings with pure golden bodies enter my monastery; may those who give with joyful hearts enter my monastery; may those whose reputations are far-recognized and unimpaired enter my monastery; and may those whose virtues are most honored and unequaled enter my monastery.'

source_sentence: 時淨飯王為如是等五百親眷，生憐愍故，將於菩薩，次第巡歷，入其精舍，悉皆周遍，然後始將入於自宮。
translation: For the pity of these five hundred members of his retinue, the Śuddhodana King would go around the bodhisattva's quarters one by one, entering them all and completely pervading them before he entered his own palace.

source_sentence: 「爾時菩薩當生之日，即有五百諸釋種子，同日而生，菩薩巍巍，最為初首。
translation: "On the day the bodhisattva was about to be born, there were 500 children of the Śākyas who were born on the same day, and the bodhisattva was so majestic that he was the first and foremost.

source_sentence: 「復有五百諸釋種女，亦同日生，耶輸陀羅而為上首。
translation: "Again, there were 500 Śākyamuni women who were born on the same day, and Yaśodharā was the leader.

source_sentence: 「復有五百諸釋奴僕，亦同日生淨飯王宮，車匿為首。
translation: "Again, there were 500 servants of the Śākyas who were born on the same day in the palace of King Jīvaka, with Chandaka at the head.

source_sentence: 「復有五百釋種婢媵，亦同日生淨飯王宮，侍衛太子。
translation: "Five hundred more maids of the Śākyas were born on the same day in the palace of King Jīvaka and guarded the prince.

source_sentence: 「復有五百鮮白馬駒，亦同日生淨飯王厩，揵陟為首。
translation: "Five hundred fresh white horses and colts were also born on the same day in King Jōtan's stable, with Gandhāra as their leader.

source_sentence: 「復有五百大香象王，色白如雪，齊有六牙，在王宮門，忽然而現。
translation: "Again, there were 500 great fragrant elephant kings, white as snow and with six tusks, who suddenly appeared at the entrance to the king's palace.

source_sentence: 「復有五百大巨伏藏，周匝四面，繞迦毘羅，自然而現。
translation: "Again, there were five hundred great, huge ambrosial elephants that circled Kapila on all sides and appeared spontaneously.

source_sentence: 「復有五百妙好園林，流泉浴池，種種花果，皆悉遍滿，並現在於迦毘羅城，四面周匝，悉是太子威德力故。
translation: "Again, there are five hundred wonderful groves, flowing springs and bathing pools, and various flowers and fruits that all fill them and appear in Kapila, surrounded on all sides by the prince's authoritative power.

source_sentence: 「復有五百大商賈主，積諸錢財，多饒珍寶，相隨來詣迦毘羅城。
translation: "Also, there were five hundred great merchant owners who had amassed a fortune full of treasures and had followed them to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 「復有五百微妙傘蓋、五百金瓶，並是五百粟散諸王，遣使送來，上淨飯王，作如是言：『今以是物，奉獻大王，慶賀太子。』
translation: "Five hundred more subtle umbrellas, five hundred gold vases, and five hundred scattered kings sent messengers up to King Jōtan, saying, 'Now, I present these things to the king to congratulate the prince.'

source_sentence: 「復有五千諸婆羅門及剎利種大富長者，各持己女，將來奉上於淨飯王。
translation: "Again, 5,000 brahmans and wealthy elders of the Śāriyas each brought their daughters and presented them to King Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王凡所須者，皆悉備具。
translation: The King of Jīvaka then had everything he needed.

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王自心思惟：『我生太子，今作何名？』
translation: "At the time, King Jōtan thought to himself, 'What will be the name of the prince I gave birth to?'

source_sentence: 復更思惟：『彼生之日一切眾事，皆悉自成，今我可為太子立名，名為成利。』
translation: Again, he thought, 'On the day he's born, all of these things will be accomplished on their own, and now I can name the prince Chengli.'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王即開藏出百億兩金，供養成利，為立名字。
translation: Then, King Jōtan opened his treasury and gave 10 billion taels of gold to Naruto to establish a name for him.

source_sentence: 是故偈言：「『如是王宮內，　　眾事悉豐饒，　　今作太子名，　　應當名成利。』
translation: Therefore, he said in a verse, "Thus, in the king's palace, all things are abundant, and now I've created a name for the crown prince that will be called 'Shōryō'.

source_sentence: 佛本行集經相師占看品第八上
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Xiang Shi Zhangyan Pin 8

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王即召相師解占觀者，呼使前來，令看太子，作如是言：『汝諸相師婆羅門等，占是太子，在我族中，為好為惡？
translation: "Then the king of Jīvaka summoned the fortune teller, called his messengers forward, made them look at the prince, and said, 'You fortune tellers, Brāhmaṇas, and others, are you looking at the prince, whether he's good or evil among my people?'

source_sentence: 汝等好看吉凶之相。』
translation: All of you, look at the signs of fortune and misfortune.'

source_sentence: 「是時諸相師婆羅門等，聞王勅已，一心瞻仰太子形容，各依先聖所有諸論，共相量宜。
translation: "After hearing the king's order, the brahmins and other form masters looked up at the prince's description with one mind, and they each assessed its appropriateness based on the treatises of previous sages.

source_sentence: 量宜訖已，白於王言：『大王！
translation: After they had evaluated their worthiness, they said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 今者大得眾利。
translation: "Now, this person has greatly benefited from a multitude of things.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此太子者，有大威德，是大眾生，今生王家。
translation: This prince, who has great authority, was born into the masses and is now born into the king's family.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，此太子身有三十二大丈夫相，凡有一人具三十二丈夫相者，於世間中，則有二種果報不差，更無餘異。
translation: You should know that this prince's body has the characteristics of thirty-two great men, and if there's one person who has the characteristics of thirty-two men, then there are two kinds of rewards in the world that aren't different, and there's nothing else.

source_sentence: 何等為二？
translation: What are the two?

source_sentence: 一若在家受世樂者，則得作於轉輪聖王，王四天下，護持大地，七寶具足，乃至不用刀杖化人，自然如法，遍於海內。
translation: 1. If someone at home enjoys worldly pleasures, then they can become a wheel-turning sage king, ruler of the four worlds, protector of the earth, fully endowed with seven treasures, and even teach people without using a sword or staff, naturally and according to the Dharma, which pervades the ocean.

source_sentence: 若捨王位，出家學道，得成如來、應、正遍知，名稱遠聞，充滿世界。』
translation: If he were to abandon his position as king and leave home to train on the path, he'd become a tathāgata, worthy, and perfectly enlightened, whose name is heard far and wide and fills the world.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王聞是記已，復更重問婆羅門言：『太子何處是大丈夫三十二相？』
translation: "After hearing this account, King Jīvaka repeatedly asked the Brāhmaṇa, 'Where, Prince, are the thirty-two marks of a great personage?'

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：『三十二種大人相者：一者太子足下安立，皆悉平滿。
translation: The Brāhmaṇas said, 'The thirty-two marks of a great personage are: first, the prince's feet are planted underneath him, and they are all even and full.

source_sentence: 二者太子雙足下，有千輻輪相，端正處中，可喜清淨。
translation: Second, underneath his feet, the prince has the shape of a thousand-spoked wheel, which is correctly placed in the middle and pleasingly pure.

source_sentence: 三者太子手指纖長。
translation: Third, the crown prince has long, slender fingers.

source_sentence: 四者太子足跟圓好。
translation: Fourth, the crown prince's heels are perfectly proportioned.

source_sentence: 五者太子足趺高隆。
translation: Fifth, the prince's feet are elevated at the level of his pedestals.

source_sentence: 六者太子手足柔軟。
translation: Six, the crown prince's hands and feet are supple and soft.

source_sentence: 七者太子手足指間具足羅網。
translation: Seven, the crown prince's hands and feet have a web between his fingers.

source_sentence: 八者太子踹如鹿王。
translation: Eight, the crown prince's legs are like those of a deer king.

source_sentence: 九者太子正立不曲二手過膝。
translation: Nine, the crown prince stands upright without bending his hands above his knees.

source_sentence: 十者太子陰馬藏相。
translation: Ten, the crown prince has the characteristic of a hidden penis.

source_sentence: 十一太子皮膚一孔一毛旋生。
translation: Eleven, the crown prince's skin has a hole in it where a single hair swirls up.

source_sentence: 十二太子身毛上靡。
translation: The twelfth prince's body hair is tousle-haired.

source_sentence: 十三太子皮膚細軟如兜羅綿。
translation: The thirteenth prince's skin is fine and soft like tulip cotton.

source_sentence: 十四太子身毛金色。
translation: The fourteenth prince's body hair is golden in color.

source_sentence: 十五太子身體淳淨。
translation: The fifteenth prince's body is pure.

source_sentence: 十六太子口中深好可喜方正。
translation: The sixteenth crown prince's mouth is deep, nice, pleasing, and square.

source_sentence: 十七太子頰車方正，如師子王。
translation: The seventeenth prince's cheeks are square like those of a lion king.

source_sentence: 十八太子兩脛廣闊。
translation: The eighteenth prince's legs are broad and wide.

source_sentence: 十九太子身體上下縱橫正等，如尼拘樹。
translation: The nineteenth prince's body is evenly spaced from top to bottom like a nyagrodha tree.

source_sentence: 二十太子七處滿好。
translation: The twenty-prince's seven parts are perfectly proportioned.

source_sentence: 二十一者具四十齒。
translation: Twenty-one has forty teeth.

source_sentence: 二十二者諸齒齊密。
translation: Twenty-two has a well-balanced set of teeth.

source_sentence: 二十三者齒不疎缺不齹不齵。
translation: Twenty-three's teeth aren't crooked or missing, and they aren't blocked or uneven.

source_sentence: 二十四者四牙白淨。
translation: Twenty-four has four teeth that are white and pure.

source_sentence: 二十五者身體清淨純黃金色。
translation: Twenty-five's body is pure and pure golden ...

source_sentence: 二十六者聲如梵王。
translation: Twenty-six has a voice like that of Brahmā.

source_sentence: 二十七者舌廣長大柔軟紅薄。
translation: Twenty-seven, his tongue is broad and long, flexible, red, and thin.

source_sentence: 二十八者所食之物皆為上味。
translation: 28. Whatever he eats has a superior taste.

source_sentence: 二十九者眼目紺青。
translation: 29. His eyes are deep blue in color.

source_sentence: 其三十者太子眉眼睫如牛王。
translation: 30. The prince's eyebrows and eyelashes are like those of a bull king.

source_sentence: 三十一者眉間白毫右旋宛轉，具足柔軟清淨光鮮。
translation: Thirty-one of them has white tuft of hair between his eyebrows that twirl to the right and are perfectly soft and pure and shiny.

source_sentence: 三十二者頂上肉髻高廣平好。
translation: Thirty-two of them have a high, wide, flat topknot.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 此是太子三十二種大丈夫相，如是具足。
translation: These are the prince's thirty-two great characteristics of a husband, which are thus fully present.

source_sentence: 若有一人具足此等丈夫相者，是人所得二種果報，在家出家如上所說。』
translation: If there's a person who possesses these characteristics of a great man, that person will attain two kinds of rewards, whether they're a householder or a renunciant, as explained above.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王聞諸相師說是語已，心大歡喜，遍體踊躍，不能自勝，即出種種百味飲食，設彼相師婆羅門等，令其自恣隨意飽滿。
translation: "After hearing these words from the form masters, King Jīvaka was overjoyed and overwhelmed with joy, so he prepared a hundred kinds of delicious foods and drinks for the form masters, such as brāhmaṇas, to fill them as he pleased.

source_sentence: 復以種種雜妙衣服，種種諸寶及餘資財，而布施之。
translation: He also gave them various kinds of fine clothing, various treasures, and other possessions.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王於迦毘羅大城之內，四衢道頭及諸街巷，處處遍滿，立無遮會，凡所須物，皆悉給與，須食與食，須飲與飲，須衣與衣，須香與香，須床敷與床敷，須房舍與房舍，須資財與資財，須駄乘與駄乘，所有功德，皆悉迴施，並為資益於太子身。
translation: At the time, the king of pure rice filled the four streets and alleys of the great city of Kapilavastu, establishing an unobstructed assembly everywhere, giving whatever was needed, giving food and eating, drinking and drinking, clothing and clothing, incense and incense, beds and beds, dwellings and dwellings, resources and resources, and the vehicle and vehicle, all of which were meritorious and beneficial to the prince himself.

source_sentence: 「是時菩薩，在天臂城嵐毘尼園，從於母胎初出生時，正憶正念，放大光明，遍滿世界，又此大地，六種震動，備十八相。
translation: "At the time, the bodhisattva was present in Lumbinī Park in the city of Indra when he was first born from his mother's womb, and when he correctly remembered and correctly concentrated, he magnified his light to fill the world with the six earth trembling with its 18 attributes.

source_sentence: 爾時，地居諸天諸仙，見此瑞已，歡喜遍身，不自勝持，揚聲叫喚，發大語言：『今日閻浮嵐毘尼中菩薩出生，為於一切天人世間作大安樂，為諸無明黑闇眾生作大光照。』
translation: At the time, the gods and sages living on the earth were overjoyed at the sight of this vision, and they were overcome with joy as they raised their voices and called out, saying, 'Today, the bodhisattva born in Jambudvīpa's Lumbinī Park will create great comfort for all gods and humans in the world and shine great light for sentient beings who are darkened by ignorance.'

source_sentence: 時四天王，聞彼地居諸天諸仙發大聲已，其四天王所在諸天，傳聞此語，復大歡喜，發大音聲，戲弄衣裳，作如是言：『今於人中，菩薩出生，為諸世間，安樂明故。』
translation: When the four heavenly kings heard that the sages of the earth-dwelling gods had made a great noise, the gods where the four heavenly kings were staying heard that, and they rejoiced greatly, made a great noise, played with their robes, and said, 'Now, among humans, a bodhisattva has been born to bring comfort and insight to the world.'

source_sentence: 三十三天，聞四天王叫喚音聲，亦大歡喜。
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods were also overjoyed when they heard the sounds of the four heavenly kings calling out.

source_sentence: 如是乃至須夜摩天從忉利聞，至兜率陀從夜摩聞，化自樂天從兜率聞，他化自在從化樂聞，展轉復至色界梵天從他化聞，梵眾天從梵天處聞，梵輔天從梵眾天聞，大梵天從梵輔天聞，光天從彼大梵天聞，少光從彼光天處聞，無量光天從少光聞，光音天從無量光聞，淨天從彼光音天聞，少淨天從淨天處聞，無量淨天從少淨，聞遍淨天從無量淨聞，廣天從彼遍淨天聞。
translation: Thus, it went on to the Sumeru Heaven, which heard it from Tuṣita, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, which heard it from Tuṣita; the Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven, which heard it from Nirmāṇarati; the Brahmakāyika Heaven, which heard it from the Paranirmitavaśavartin; the Brahma Heaven, which heard it from the Brahmakāyika Heaven; the Mahābrahma Heaven, which heard it from the Mahābrahma Heaven; the Luminous Heaven, which heard it from the Luminous Heaven; the Infinite Luminosity Heaven, which heard it from the Infinite Luminosity; the Pure Heaven, which heard it from the Pure Heaven; the Infinitely Pure Heaven, which heard it from the Less Pure Heaven; the Universally Pure Heaven, which heard it from the Infinitely Pure Heaven; and the Vairocana Heaven, which heard it from the Universally Pure Heaven.

source_sentence: 從於廣天至少廣天，從少廣天至無量廣，從無量廣至廣果天，從廣果天至於熱天，從於熱天至無熱天，從無熱天至無比天，從無比天至善現天，從善現天如是次第，一剎那頃，乃至到於阿迦尼吒。
translation: From the Vairocana Heaven to the Vairocana Heaven, from the Lesser Vairocana Heaven to the Immeasurably Vairocana Heaven, from the Immeasurably Vairocana Heaven to the Vairocana Heaven, from the Vairocana Heaven to the Maitreya Heaven, from the Maitreya Heaven to the Ineffable Heaven, from the Ineffable Heaven to the Well-Formed Heaven, and from the Well-Formed Heaven to the Akaniṣṭha Heaven in this order, in a single moment of time, up to Akaniṣṭha.

source_sentence: 一切諸天，各各唱言：『今日菩薩，生於世間，為於天人作大安樂，為於黑暗盲冥眾生作大燈明。』
translation: All the gods each called out, 'Today, the bodhisattva was born in the world to create great comfort for gods and humans and a great lamp for dark and blind sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，有一阿私陀仙，在三十三天上安居，見彼諸天，歡喜踊躍，不能自勝，或弄衣裳，揚聲如前。
translation: "At the time, there was an Asita sage who was staying up in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven and saw the gods rejoicing and jumping up and down, unable to control themselves, or they were fussing with their robes and raising their voices as before.

source_sentence: 見已即問彼諸天言：『仁者大德！
translation: After he saw them, he asked the gods, 'Sir, great!

source_sentence: 三十三天今以何故，歡喜踊躍，遍滿身中，不能自勝，復大叫喚，手弄衣冠？』
translation: What is it about the Trāyastriṃśa gods that causes them to rejoice and dance all over their bodies, unable to overcome themselves, and then to shout loudly and toss their robes with their hands?'

source_sentence: 說是語已，三十三天報彼仙人阿私陀言：『阿私陀仙大德不聞，今人世間閻浮提地，當於北方雪山之下，有釋種城，名迦毘羅。
translation: After he spoke these words, the Trāyastriṃśa gods reported to the sage Ashita, saying, 'Sir Ashita, haven't you heard that in the present human world, in the land of Jambudvīpa, there's a city of the Śākyas named Kapila, which is located under Mount Snow in the north.

source_sentence: 彼城有王，名為淨飯。
translation: In that city there's a king named Jñānacandra.

source_sentence: 彼王最大夫人生子，極大端正，可喜絕殊，身色黃金，頭如傘蓋，鼻高圓直，兩臂下垂，形體端嚴，六根具足，處處皆充，如鑄金挺，具三十二大丈夫相，備八十種微妙之好。
translation: The king's eldest wife gives birth to a son who's extremely large and correct, absolutely delightful, with a body the color of gold, a head like an umbrella, a high, round nose, straight, two arms that hang down, a dignified body, a well-balanced set of six faculties, a well-rounded body that fills every place like cast gold, thirty-two great characteristics, and eighty subtle features.

source_sentence: 大仙！
translation: Great sage!

source_sentence: 彼之菩薩決定得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，成已決定轉於無上清淨法輪。
translation: That bodhisattva is certain to achieve supreme, perfect enlightenment and, after achieving it, is certain to turn the unsurpassed, pure Dharma wheel.

source_sentence: 而彼菩薩能於一切天人魔梵、沙門婆羅門等諸世間中，自證諸通。
translation: That bodhisattva can realize for himself the supernormal abilities of all gods, humans, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, priests, and other worldly beings.

source_sentence: 證諸通已，闡揚正法，其法祕密，初中後善，義味深妙，具足說於清淨梵行。
translation: After realizing those powers, he explains the right teaching, which is esoteric, junior and senior, profound in flavor and subtle in meaning, and fully explains the pure religious practice.

source_sentence: 彼說法時，所有一切諸眾生等，以聞法故，有生法者，斷絕生法；受老法者，斷其老法；受病法者，得斷病法；受死法者，得斷死法；憂愁苦惱，悉得斷除，滅其根本。』
translation: When he teaches the Dharma, all sentient beings who hear the Dharma will end the law of birth; those who experience the law of old age will end the law of old age; those who experience the law of illness will end the law of illness; those who experience the law of death will end the law of death; and all grief and suffering will be ended, and their root will be destroyed.'

source_sentence: 阿私陀仙從彼三十三天聞已，心生重信，即於彼天，隱身來下，現增長林。
translation: After hearing this from the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, the sage Ashita had a deep faith in his heart, and he came down from his hiding place in that heaven to appear in the forest of growth.

source_sentence: 「爾時，復有說如是言：南天竺地，有一城名優禪耶尼，去城不遠，山名頻陀，於其中間，更有一山，名阿私陀。
translation: "At the time, another person said this: 'In the southern India, there's a city named Ujjayinī that's not far from there, and there's a mountain named Vindhu, and in between it there's another mountain named Ashita.

source_sentence: 是時仙人，於彼山居，以彼山故，即稱仙人，名阿私陀。
translation: An immortal then lives on that mountain, and because of that mountain, he's called an immortal named Ashita.

source_sentence: 其仙人從忉利天下，在彼山時，阿私陀仙將一侍者，名那羅陀，從彼山中，隱身來此迦毘羅城，去城不遠下而立住，作是思惟：『我昔於此迦毘羅城，聞眾國師及婆羅門云：「淨飯王生菩薩子，彼是天人及我等師，不得輕忽。」
translation: When he was on that mountain, the sage Ashita sent an attendant named Nārada from that mountain, who had come to Kapila in hiding, stood down not far from the city, and thought, 'Once, when I was here in Kapila, I heard that the state masters and brāhmaṇas said, 'The Son of Bodhisattva born to King Jīvaka, that's a god and our teacher, so we mustn't despise him.'"

source_sentence: 若我今於迦毘羅城，現神通入，無有此理。
translation: If I were to show my supernormal powers and enter Kapilavastu now, there's no such thing.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 迦毘羅城，不同往昔。
translation: "The city of Kapilavastu is not like it used to be.

source_sentence: 今日若往，應當更現其餘異相。
translation: If I go there today, I'll see the rest of the city's different features.

source_sentence: 我應敬彼如事尊神，我寧步行，入彼城內。』
translation: I should honor that god as I serve him, but I'd better enter the city on foot.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀及其侍者那羅陀身徒步共入迦毘羅城，從小巷裏，私竊欲向淨飯王所，到宮門前。
translation: Asita and his attendant Nārāditya then entered Kapilavastu on foot and went down a side street, secretly wanting to go to King Jīvaka and reach the palace gate.

source_sentence: 時迦毘羅人民稠閙，處處遍滿，間無有空，為菩薩故，作大莊嚴。
translation: At the time, the people of Kapilavastu were so crowded that there was no room between them, and they made a great adornment for the sake of the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 「時諸大眾，見彼仙人步行而來，入迦毘羅，復從小巷，趣向淨飯大王宮門，見已無量無邊人民，雲雨而集隨逐仙人，心生驚愕，怪不敢問。
translation: "When the crowd saw that sage come on foot, enter Kapila, go down the alley again, and head for the palace gate of King Jōtoku, they were startled at the sight of the measureless and limitless people who had gathered in clouds and rain to follow the sage, and they were surprised and didn't dare to ask.

source_sentence: 以何義故？
translation: What does that mean?

source_sentence: 仙人致此。
translation: This is where the sage comes from.

source_sentence: 時彼大眾，城內人民，或在自家門前而立，或在窓邊，或倚构欄，或在臺頭，或在屋上，觀彼仙人，各相謂言：『往昔此仙，來入迦毘羅婆城時，乘大神通騰空而行，到於淨飯大王宮中。
translation: The crowd and the people of the city were standing in front of their houses, or standing by their windows, or leaning against a railing, or on a dais, or on a roof, and they each looked at the sage and said, 'In the past, when this sage came to enter Kapilavastu, he traveled by great supernormal powers through the air and arrived at the palace of the great king Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 今日步行而來入城，我等不知。
translation: Now, we don't know that he's come into the city on foot.

source_sentence: 以何義故，步涉而來？』
translation: What's the reason he walked here?'

source_sentence: 「時阿私陀至淨飯王宮門前已，語當門人，作如是言：『我婆羅門，久來耆耄，猶如祖父，今日步行，翻似年少二十小兒，及那羅陀童子而來，其那羅陀，年始八歲，汝可為我白淨飯王。』
translation: "When Asita arrived at the gate of the palace of King Jīvaka, he said to the person at the gate, 'I, Brāhmaṇa, have long been elderly, like a grandfather, and today I'm walking like a young boy of 20 years old who came with the boy Nārāditya, who is just eight years old.

source_sentence: 時守門者，語仙人言：『如尊者教，我當奉諮。』
translation: The gatekeeper then said to the sage, 'As the venerable has taught, I will consult you.'

source_sentence: 即入宮門，漸漸而行，到於王前，具以白王。
translation: He then entered the palace gate, gradually made his way there, and went before the king and explained everything to him.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞此語已，心大敬仰，歡喜無量，即從座起，語彼通事守門人言：『汝急疾引仙人將來，勿使淹遲。』
translation: Upon hearing this, King Jīvaka greatly admired and rejoiced incalculably. He rose from his seat and told the gatekeeper who was in charge of the monks, 'Hurry up and bring the sage to the palace; don't be late.'

source_sentence: 時守門者還仙人所，而作是言：『大仙知時，宜速入宮。』
translation: The gatekeeper then returned to the sage and said, 'When the great sage knows it's time, he should quickly enter the palace.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀聞彼語已，即共侍者那羅陀入淨飯王宮。
translation: After he heard what he said, Asita went with his attendant Nārada into the palace of King Jōtoku.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王遙在殿，見阿私陀仙漸漸而行將至王所，是時大王即從座起，詣仙人所，承事迎接，扶持其腋，將好最勝最妙第一希有寶座，安置令坐，坐已禮拜，口唱是言：『我今恭敬禮拜尊者。』
translation: When the king of Jīvaka was distant in the palace and saw the sage Ashita gradually making his way to the king's palace, the king rose from his seat, went to the sage, greeted him, supported him by his armpit, installed him on the most excellent, wonderful, and rare jeweled throne, made him sit down, and after he sat down, he paid homage and said, 'Now, I respectfully venerate the venerable.'

source_sentence: 是時仙人，口即呪願淨飯王言：『唯願大王！
translation: The sage then said a mantra to Venerable Śuddhodana, saying, 'Please, Great King!

source_sentence: 常得安樂。』
translation: They'll always attain well-being.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王白仙人言：『尊者何求故屈到此？
translation: "The King of Jīvaka then said to the sage, 'Venerable, why have you stooped to this place in search of something?'

source_sentence: 為須衣耶？
translation: Is it necessary to have a robe?

source_sentence: 為須食乎？
translation: Why do we need to eat?

source_sentence: 為復求須其餘諸事？
translation: Why do you seek the other things?

source_sentence: 須者但道，我悉備具，必與不違。』
translation: 'Just tell me what you need, and I'll provide it all. I won't disagree with you.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀，諮白王言：『大王！
translation: Asita then consulted the king and said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，今我來者，無所乏少，不求衣食，一切諸事，悉所不須。
translation: You should know that now I've come because I have nothing to lack and don't seek clothing or food, and I don't need any of the things I have.

source_sentence: 然我今者故從遠來，欲見大王最勝童子。
translation: Still, I've come from far away to see the king's most excellent boy.

source_sentence: 大王慈恩，願當示我善勝童子。』
translation: With your kindness, Great King, please show me the boy who's good and excellent.'

source_sentence: 是時童子，在於寶座，睡臥眠寢。
translation: The boy then was sitting on his jeweled throne, sleeping, and sleeping.

source_sentence: 淨飯王語阿私陀言：『尊者大仙！
translation: King Śuddhodana said to Asita, 'Venerable Great Teacher!

source_sentence: 少時留心，童子今眠，猶未覺寤，願待須臾。』
translation: 'Pay close attention for a while, for the boy is still awake from his sleep, and I wish to wait a moment.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀即白王言：『大王！
translation: Asita then said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 莫說如是語言，稱童子睡。
translation: Don't say such words and call the boy asleep.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我等雖寤，猶如睡人。
translation: Even though we're awake, we're just like people who are asleep.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 童子久來斷除，無復眠睡，晝夜恒為諸眾生等，得安樂故、大利益故，而入禪定。』
translation: The boy has long since stopped, has no more sleep, and enters meditative concentration day and night because of the comfort and great benefit he attains for sentient beings and others.'

source_sentence: 「時，淨飯王知童子眠寤時欲至，即入宮內，勅令莊嚴宮舍殿堂，淨水灑地，掃除糞穢，香水重灑，花散其上，在在處處，安置香鑪，燒雜妙香。
translation: "Knowing that the boy's time of sleep and waking was approaching, King Jīvaka then went inside the palace and ordered that the palace halls be adorned, the floors be sprinkled with clean water, the dung be swept away, perfume be repeatedly sprinkled, flowers be scattered, and incense stoves be placed everywhere, and a variety of wonderful incense be burned.

source_sentence: 復懸種種繒綵幡蓋，垂諸旒蘇，竪大寶幢。
translation: It also hung various silken banners and flags, draped them with tassels, and erected a great jeweled banner.

source_sentence: 復懸無量真珠瓔珞真珠羅網，種種寶鈴，垂覆其上，懸眾雜寶，猶如日月星宿之光。
translation: Hanging over them are countless beads, necklace, beads, and nets of jewelry, and various bells draped with a variety of jewelry, just like the light of the sun, moon, stars, and constellations.

source_sentence: 復掛種種妙寶衣裳，喻如飛天，手持花瓔。
translation: They also hang a variety of wonderfully jeweled robes that are likened to flying celestials holding flowered diadems.

source_sentence: 復懸雜色朱紫紅黃種種眾毦。
translation: They also hang a variety of nectar of various colors, such as violet, purple, red, and yellow.

source_sentence: 諸如是等，挍飾精麗莊嚴宮中，如乾闥城一種無異。
translation: They were beautifully adorned, adorned the palace, and were like the city of Qianzhong, one of a kind.

source_sentence: 復召釋種內外眷屬，最大最勝威德尊者，令來入宮，使共摩耶夫人一處。
translation: He summoned the inner and outer retinues of the Śākyas, the greatest and most authoritative of them all, and had them enter the palace and put them in the same place as Mrs. Māyā.

source_sentence: 是時摩耶詣童子所，至已持手抱童子頭，令向仙人擬如禮拜仙人之足；是時童子威德力故，其身自轉，足向仙人。
translation: When she arrived, she held the boy's head in her hands and made him bow to the sage's feet as if he were an immortal; because of the boy's authoritative power, his body turned on its own and his feet were directed toward the sage.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王更復共扶迴童子頭，令拜仙人；童子力故，足還自轉，向彼仙人。
translation: Again, King Jīvaka helped the boy return to his head and caused him to worship the sage; because of the boy's strength, his feet turned on their own and he headed toward the sage.

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王復迴童子，頭向仙人，還復轉足，如是至三。
translation: The Vimalakīrti king then returned the boy's head to the sage and turned his feet again, and so on up to three times.

source_sentence: 其阿私陀遙見童子，是時童子，放常光明照觸大地，童子威德，端正可喜，色純黃金，頭如寶蓋，鼻直而圓，脩臂下垂，支節正等，無缺無減，具足莊嚴。
translation: Asita then saw the boy from a distance, and he radiated an eternal light that touched the earth. The boy was a delightful, dignified figure of pure gold in appearance, with a head like a jeweled lid, a straight and round nose, well-proportioned arms that hung down, and correctly proportioned limbs that were perfectly adorned without flaw or loss.

source_sentence: 「時阿私陀即從座起，白於王言：『大王！
translation: "Asita then rose from his seat and said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 莫將童子聖頭迴向於我。
translation: Don't turn the boy's noble head back toward me.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼頭不合頂禮我足，我頭應當頂禮彼足。』
translation: He doesn't bow at my feet with his head, but I should bow at his feet with mine.'

source_sentence: 復唱是言：『希有希有！
translation: Again, he called out, 'Rarely, rarely!'

source_sentence: 大人出世，最大希有，大人出世！
translation: Great man out of this world, greatest of all hope, great man out of this world!

source_sentence: 我本從天所聞之者，即此童子！
translation: This is the boy from whom I originally heard from heaven!

source_sentence: 真實定是，如彼不異。』
translation: 'It's certainly true, just as it is.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀整理衣服，偏袒右臂，右膝著地，伸其兩手，抱持童子，安其頂上，還復本座。
translation: Asita then adjusted his robes, bared his right arm, knelt on his right knee, stretched out his two hands, took the boy in his arms, placed him on top of his head, and returned to his original seat.

source_sentence: 本座坐已，還下童子，置於膝上。
translation: After he had finished sitting in his original seat, he returned, lowered the boy, and placed him on his knees.

source_sentence: 是時摩耶國大夫人即白大仙阿私陀言：『仁者尊師！
translation: The great lady of Maya then said to the great sage Asita, 'Venerable sir!

source_sentence: 當令童子禮大仙足。』
translation: You will make the boy bow at the feet of the great sage.'

source_sentence: 阿私陀仙報夫人言：『國大夫人！
translation: The Sage Asita replied to the lady, 'Great Lady Guk!

source_sentence: 莫作是語。
translation: 'Don't say that!

source_sentence: 今是童子，不應禮我；我及一切諸天世人，應當接足禮拜童子。』
translation: 'Now, this boy shouldn't venerate me; I and all the gods and humans should bow down and worship the boy.'

source_sentence: 「時淨飯王即持種種雜妙珍寶，以用嚫施阿私陀仙。
translation: "It was then that King Jōtan took a variety of wonderful treasures and gave them in dakṣiṇā to the sage Āśīdra.

source_sentence: 時阿私陀，持自澡罐，以水洗手，受此施物，受已即持迴奉童子。
translation: Ashita then took his bathing pot, washed his hands with water, accepted the offering, and returned it to the boy after accepting it.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王白阿私陀大仙人言：『尊者大仙！
translation: King Jōtan then said to the great sage Asita, 'Venerable great sage!

source_sentence: 我以此物，施於尊者，唯願納受。』
translation: With this gift, I'd like to offer it to you, Venerable, if you'd accept it.'

source_sentence: 仙人報言：『大王施我，我今迴施最勝童子。』
translation: The sage replied, 'Great king, I've given it to you, and now I'll give it back to the most excellent boy.'

source_sentence: 淨飯王言：『我知大仙福田勝故，供養大師。』
translation: King Śuddhodana said, 'I know the great sage's field of merit is superior, so I'm making offerings to the great teacher.'

source_sentence: 阿私陀仙，復報王言：『我今見是勝因緣故，迴施童子。』
translation: Again, the sage Asita replied to the king, 'Now, I've seen this excellent cause and condition for giving back to the boy.'

source_sentence: 淨飯王言：『大聖尊仙！
translation: King Śuddhodana said, 'Great sage sage!

source_sentence: 我今不解尊師此意。』
translation: Now, I don't understand what your venerable teacher means by this.'

source_sentence: 仙人復言：『大王！
translation: The sage then replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我今身心，深自歸伏於此童子。』
translation: 'You should know that I've deeply subjugated myself, body and soul, to this boy.'

source_sentence: 淨飯王言：『何因何緣？
translation: King Śuddhodana said, 'What's the cause and conditions?'

source_sentence: 願為解釋。』
translation: Please explain this for me.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀即報王言：『大王諦心，善聽是義，我當為王說其本末。
translation: Asita then reported to the king, saying, 'Great king, be attentive, and listen well to this meaning; I will explain its origin for the king.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，我昔在於忉利天上，安居行道，忽見忉利一切諸天，歡喜踊躍，充遍其身，不能自勝，舞弄衣冠，跳躑悅豫。
translation: You should know that I was once in the Heaven of the Thirty-three Gods, living peacefully on the path, when I suddenly saw all the Thirty-three Gods rejoicing and jumping for joy, unable to control themselves, dancing with their robes and jumping for joy.

source_sentence: 我時於彼，即便問言：「諸天仁者！
translation: I then asked them, "Gentlemen, gods!

source_sentence: 何因何緣，歡喜騰躍，不能自勝，執持衣冠，舞弄躑躅？」
translation: "What causes do they stand up and dance with joy, unable to get over themselves, holding their robes and robe, and dancing around?"

source_sentence: 作是語已，忉利諸天即答我言：「大德仙人！
translation: After saying this, the Heaven of the Thirty-three replied to me, "Great sage!

source_sentence: 汝今知不？
translation: Do you now know?

source_sentence: 於下世間北方地內雪山之下，有釋種城，名迦毘羅，彼城有王，名為淨飯。
translation: In the lower world, in the northern region beneath the snow-capped mountains, there's a city of the Śākyas named Kapila, and there's a king in that city named Jaladhara.

source_sentence: 彼王最大第一夫人，產一童子，端正可喜，人所樂見。
translation: The king's eldest and first wife gives birth to a young child who is beautiful and pleasing to behold.

source_sentence: 身黃金色，頭圓鼻直，足滿臂長，猶如金像，備具三十二大人相、八十種好，必定得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，當轉無上清淨法輪。
translation: His body is yellow-golden, his head is round and straight, and his legs are full and his arms long, just like a golden statue, fully endowed with thirty-two major marks and eighty major features, which will surely lead to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and the turning of the unsurpassed, pure Dharma wheel.

source_sentence: 今此童子，相貌具足，決是無疑。
translation: This boy's appearance is perfectly proportioned, and there's definitely no doubt about it.

source_sentence: 今此童子，以自神力，能知此世及以過去未來世等，天人魔梵、沙門婆羅門等，一切世間，自證知已，分別法相，乃至略說種種苦惱，可解脫者令得解脫。」
translation: By virtue of his own psychic powers, this boy can know about this world and past and future worlds, gods, humans, Māra, Brahmā, ascetics, priests, and so forth, and all worlds, and after he personally discerns and discerns the characteristics of things, he even briefly explains the various sufferings and distress and causes those who can be liberated to be liberated."

source_sentence: 大王我於彼時，聞是語已故，來至此觀看童子。』
translation: ''Great king, I came here to see the boy after hearing those words.''

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王報仙人言：『若如是者，大憐愍我，大饒益我，無覆憂愁。
translation: The Jīvaka King then rewarded the sage, saying, 'If this is the case, it's a great pity for me, a great benefit, and unsurpassed sorrow.

source_sentence: 更有何法，過四種行，四行過已，能勝能最。
translation: What else could there be that goes beyond the four practices and, after going beyond them, is superior and most effective?'

source_sentence: 今此童子，既人所生，能於未來，得無上道。』
translation: Now, this boy, born from a human birth, will attain the unsurpassed path in the future.'

source_sentence: 阿私陀仙，復白王言：『大王！
translation: Again, Sage Asita said to the king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，彼等一切諸婆羅門，在在處處，云何得勝而證知耶？』
translation: You should know, how do all these brāhmaṇas, in all places, attain superior knowledge?'

source_sentence: 時，淨飯王復更諮白於仙人言：『我今在於大仙之前，願為解說，令我樂聞。』
translation: King Jōtan then again consulted the sage, saying, 'Now that I'm here before the great sage, may I ask him to explain this to you so that I can listen with pleasure.'

source_sentence: 時阿私陀答言：『大王！
translation: Asita then answered, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 如我相傳婆羅門家，四毘陀經說，往昔有一婆羅門名曰羖羊，復有婆羅門名拔迦利，復有婆羅門名拔伽婆，復有婆羅門名末檀地，復有婆羅門名迦吒囉唎，復有婆羅門名般適尸棄，彼等皆得阿修羅王算計之法，得勝得上。
translation: As we say in the Sutra of the Four Vedas, there once was a Brāhmaṇa named Ewe, and there was another Brāhmaṇa named Bakkali, another Brāhmaṇa named Bhagavat, another Brāhmaṇa named Mātṛdhi, another Brāhmaṇa named Kāṭalala, and another Brāhmaṇa named Pañcikaśikhin, all of whom attained victory and superiority in the king of asuras' method of calculation.
